Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. Failure to provide proof of vaccination for any required vaccines or obtain a medical or religious exemption from the University will result in rescission of a candidate’s offer of employment or disciplinary action up to and including termination.

title: Assistant Project Administrator (Assistant Project Manager)
description:
**Job description**

  



The Assistant Project Administrator is responsible for assisting the Project Administrator with the financial, administrative, and customer-relations success of the projects to which the department is assigned. Major objectives include assisting the Project Administrator in project management to ensure that each project is completed to the satisfaction of the customer and within the parameters as defined by the contract.

 **Qualifications**


* Self-starter with a proactive attitude who can anticipate needs and achieve success with minimum direction.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills (both written and verbal).
* Quick learner who focuses on high productivity and results.
* Detail-oriented, ability to multi-task and manage time well.
* Ability to manage multiple mid-scale projects simultaneously.
* Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure.
* Excellent work ethic.
* Preferably Bilingual – Must be able to communicate in English and Spanish both verbal and written.
* Computer skills, including Word, Excel, Microsoft Outlook.
* 2 – 4 years of administrative support in the construction field is desirable

 **Responsibilities Include but Are Not Limited To (Duties listed below are gradually added depending on your experience level. Training is provided for this position.) :**


* Ensures the proper administration and filing of project documentation, including the project contract, field reports, Change Orders, shop drawings, submittals, correspondence, specifications, purchase orders, and other related project documentation.
* Reviews Daily Job Logs, investigate any onsite issues, and email percentage of production as well as onsite issues to the team. Maintains the Project Log and assigns the Project Number.
* Creates the Project and Field Books, including the Facility Information Sheet for Field Project Books, and distributes them to the Field crew.
* Secures all permits, licenses, bonds, and insurance certificates.
* Ensures that all permits, licenses, bonds, and insurance certificates are billed to the client as appropriate.
* Secures qualified Subcontractors, if necessary, and assists Project Administrator in creating subcontract agreements.
* Assists the Project Administrator &/or Project Manager with buying out of all company supplied material and equipment, and issues purchase orders to all subcontractors and vendors to establish commitments for project costs.
* Works with the Project Administrator to coordinate and schedule the final inspections and receipt of all necessary certificates; closes permits.
* Assists Project Administrator, Project Manager, &/or Financial Manager in the preparation of invoices to ensure that all contracts are invoiced as soon as the work is completed, including Change Orders.
* Assists the President with the preparation and submission of Bid Proposals
* Updates weekly Project Meeting report with Quotes & Bid status

  


**Job Type:** Full-time

  


**Salary**


* Salary starting from $45,000 - $75,000 based on experience.
* Position eligible for Overtime when necessary.
* Incentives to earn an annual salary increase - up to an additional $5,200 - within the first 6 months!

  


**Benefits:**


* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance
* PTO- Vacation, Sick, & Holidays
* On-the-job training and mentorship
* Emphasis on professional development

  


**Schedule:**


* 8-hour shift with Overtime as needed

  


**Ability to commute/relocate:**


* Hawthorne, NY 10532: Reliably commute or planning to relocate (Required)

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree &/or comparable experience (Preferred)

  


**Experience:**


* Construction: 2 years (Preferred)
* Microsoft Office: 2 years (Preferred)

  


**Work Location**: In person

Salary: $45,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

* 8 hour shift
